These plants are typically found in wetland or marshy environments, where they thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Streptostachys species are characterized by their grass-like appearance, with slender stems and narrow, linear leaves. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil in aquatic habitats.
